name: ImageData
description: The ImageData interface represents the underlying pixel data of an area of a <canvas> element. It is created using the ImageData() constructor or creator methods on the CanvasRenderingContext2D object associated with a canvas: createImageData() and getImageData(). It can also be used to set a part of the canvas by using putImageData().

members.name: ImageData()
members.description: Creates an ImageData object from a given Uint8ClampedArray and the size of the image it contains. If no array is given, it creates an image of a black rectangle. Note that this is the most common way to create such an object in workers as createImageData() is not available there.

parameters.name: array Optional
parameters.description: A Uint8ClampedArray containing the underlying pixel representation of the image. If no such array is given, an image with a black rectangle of the given dimension will be created.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: An unsigned long representing the width of the represented image.

parameters.name: Â height
parameters.description: An unsigned long representing the height of the represented image. This value is optional if an array is given: it will be inferred from its size and the given width.

members.name: ImageData.data
members.description: Is a Uint8ClampedArray representing a one-dimensional array containing the data in the RGBA order, with integer values between 0 and 255 (included).

members.name: ImageData.height
members.description: Is an unsigned long representing the actual height, in pixels, of the ImageData.

members.name: ImageData.width
members.description: Is an unsigned long representing the actual width, in pixels, of the ImageData.
